urls.title: WWT responds to Environment Agency‚Äôs warning that reaching net zero ‚Äònot enough to save our planet‚Äô
urls.description: Environment Agency Chief Executive Sir James Bevan warned government and business on Tuesday (16 March) that we need climate adaptation measures as well as net zero ambitions, describing them as ‚Äútwo sides of the same coin‚Äù.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency says: üì¢ #NetZero is not enough to save the planet; climate adaption measures are vital too.

We say: üì¢ Wetlands are the answer!

Our #BlueRecovery plan to create and restore 100k hectares of wetlands will help the UK adapt and thrive > https://t.co/VtC4Cmgvvh https://t.co/4GgVoODeu0

@FineCountryside @DefraGovUK @DefraNature @EnvAgency @UKParliament @MoorlandMonitor @WildlifeTrusts @CraigBennett3 @CarolineLucas @PeatlandACTION @IUCNpeat Thanks. Yes burning any sort of upland area like this has a catastrophic impact on wildlife. Then there is all the carbon released by the burning. And then there is the degradation of the peat.

urls.title: HS2 begins work on UK‚Äôs longest rail viaduct
urls.description: HS2 began work this week on the UK‚Äôs longest railway bridge, with an expert team of ground engineers sinking the first of almost 300 piles that will form the foundations for the Colne Valley Viaduct.

tweets.text: Set low in the landscape, the Colne Valley Viaduct #design is inspired by a stone skipping across water. It also enables views and minimises the viaduct‚Äôs footprint. We're working with Affinity Water & @EnvAgency to monitor water quality during building: https://t.co/buIn6X4FVl https://t.co/DARevhgBDy

urls.title: Flash flooding from rivers | The Flood Hub
urls.description: The information on this page has been provided by the Environment Agency and was correct at the time of upload. Flash flooding usually results from intense and heavy rainfall. It occurs in areas where rivers are very responsive to heavy rainfall. Unlike most other types of flooding, the localised nature and speed of the river response means that flooding can occur before flood warnings are issued. Precisely where flash floods will strike can be difficult to predict accurately as it can occur in places
